messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] OT: A Clockwork Orange
messages.msgSnippet: Hey guys. Actually, Nate, the book wasn t bad.  But get the Norton Paperback version.  From what I understand, it s the first American edition to include the
messages.messageBody:
Hey guys.
Actually, Nate, the book wasn't bad. But get the Norton Paperback
version. From what I understand, it's the first American edition to include the
entire book. For some reason known only to God Himself, the FIRST American
edition (the one Kubrick's adaptation is based on) left off the last chapter.
I did rent Kubrick's ACO for my dad when I worked there, but he didn't
care for it. As I said, not being a movie fan (aside from the occasional),
I've not seen it, but I may buy the DVD someday just to have it. And who
knows, I may watch it someday. :-) And even like it as much as the book. :-)

L8r
Tim


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
